title: Commander Keen 20,000
content:
...is finished. (Tentatively. No Multimedia Fusion project is EVER finished.)

Version 1.0 is available for download here:

[url=http://files.commanderkeen.org/users/kohntarkosz/ck20k.zip]files.commanderkeen.org/u.../ck20k.zip[/url]
Size: 12MB

If you have MMF 1.5 or better and are interested in playing around with the game engine, you can download a CCA file of it here:

[url=http://files.commanderkeen.org/users/kohntarkosz/EngineDemo.zip]files.commanderkeen.org/u...neDemo.zip[/url] (LINK FIXED)
Size: 1.4MB

A hearty thanks go out to Grafix for web-hosting and to everyone who beta-tested.

title: Re: Commander Keen 20,000
content: oOOOhhh...linux is your problem...I had no idea. I will upload some screenshots in the morning.

title: Re: Commander Keen 20,000
content:
Okay, I'm downloading it now. It was nutsing up earlier, but now I can play it. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

Further updates as events warrant. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

EDIT: I've just tried playing this, and I must say that I'm impressed! One can never tell what to expect from a game made with something like Multimedia Fusion, but I think that this is pretty neat. The characters and levels so far are very interesting, and the gameplay is quite nice, with pogoing, ledge-grabbing, moving platforms, etc. I ran out of lives on level 2, though...I shall try again and see if I can get further. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

Good job! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rollhead.gif[/img] [img]http://i91.photobucket.com/albums/k284/KeegTech/WarholDopefishPNG2.png[/img]

title: Re: Commander Keen 20,000
content:
Wow... a well made fan game! The tree doors are great, something I've not seen yet (but may have to plagiarise for the Community Mod sometime).

The gameplay is annoying slow, though. Quick maneuvers, like turning and firing at a bird before it hits you, are very difficult, and it's so suspenseful to do something as simple as jumping!

Also, the game stops for half a second whenever I collect an item.

Nice work. If you can fix up these problems a bit, I'll play further!

content:

title: Re: Commander Keen 20,000
content:
Thanks for the feedback, guys!

What's the clock speed of your computer, Spleen?

title: Re: Commander Keen 20,000
content:
Honestly man, this project is really pretty good. I've only gotten to level 2. The engine is decent, it's definitely better than most other keen games, but beaten by a few (Issis and Spork III come to mind). Graphics are really pretty good, the music over all works well with the theme.

The pogo is a little bit jacked up, but over all, it's really good.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: Commander Keen 20,000
content:
[hr]kohntarkosz What's the clock speed of your computer, Spleen?
[hr]Enough that it's a non-issue. An Athlon 64 3700+ with a GeForce 7800GT and 1Gb RAM.

I originally figured the pausing has something to do with playing the sound that goes with collecting something, but it doesn't happen when I shoot or get killed, so there must be something else going on.

title: Re: Commander Keen 20,000
content:
OH WOW. This is impressive! I really like playing this little demo. Bit crude movement, but that'll get better soon, I'm sure. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
Haha, nice music/sound remakes, too. You might want to make looping versions of these songs, though.
Oh, can't you just keep the songs their original names and put them in a 'songs' subdirectory?
Are you going to make a level editor (using some objects and an array) in the future?

EDIT: replacing the useful F2 restart key with play/mute samples is annoying though.

EDIT 2: oh, this is a finished game? The menus are way simple though, and I missed a world map. And a status thing. And the graphics were a bit basic in some places. Needs a bit more work to really show this is a "finished product". [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

YET ANOTHER EDIT: what about submitting the game to www.create-games.com? You'll get some nice criticism/info/tips on how to improve your game while you reach a larger public (part of which likes Keen). [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] ____________
Don't see me as an ordinary man.
Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]
Oh, and [url=http://www.tengusoft.net/]Team[/url].

title: Re: Commander Keen 20,000
content:
Thanks for your input, Vince. I butchered the menus a little bit because I didn't think anyone would actually use them - in fact, they should be completely invisible, and if you can see them we have a problem. If you want a status thing, hit 'tab' during gameplay (see the help screen).

The music doesn't loop smoothly because MP3 files *never* loop smoothly.

And Clickteam already makes a level editor for this, it's called MMF 1.5. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dexter.gif[/img]

title: Re: Commander Keen 20,000
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]The music doesn't loop smoothly because MP3 files *never* loop smoothly.[hr][/quote]
I mean as in make the music loopable instead of having such a defined end.

[quote]Quote:[hr]And Clickteam already makes a level editor for this, it's called MMF 1.5. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dexter.gif[/img] [hr][/quote]
Using some kind of tiling system and the array object, level editing becomes easier, accessible for non-MMF users, your game becomes expandable, and the biggest advantage is that you will only ever need one frame that loads the correct level file - which means that if you change an event, you don't have to go through all the frames changing all of them.

I didn't feel like pointing out some things I encountered last night, so here I go:

Not being able to save and load is REALLY lacking this game. Sure, you get a password every once in a while, but that's just... so un-Keenish! It's not difficult to make a save file - just store the lives, score etcetera in an INI when pressing a function key.

Not being able to see the stats without pressing a key is not handy. Try to do like they did in the original games - some basic stats where you have the level name right now. Those stats are more important than a level name, so make those show up by default. In fact, there's plenty of space to leave the level name below it or something.

Menus are useful, and they just really feel neglected in this game. Select an option and you get a red screen full of text - could use polish. The sound test also does absolutely nothing. If you make a menu, make sure it's either compact or fully functional and polished. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] Also, the Quit option is selected by default, you might wanna change that.

Movement is a bit sloppy in some cases. For example, collision around climbable borders gives some problems occasionally, like Keen getting a jump boost or still moving a bit while hanging onto the ledge. Jumping is fixed height, while variable height jumping could make for some nice level designs. Oh, I just remembered, slope walking works like crap, you need to fix that. Use a fastloop to push him down a few pixels if some bottom detector is overlapping the ground, but Keen isn't, for example. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]
More movement system problems: rapid shooting when jumping and shooting down, being able to shoot while pogo-ing and NOT stopping to pogo, small animation problems when walking against irregular walls or doing stuff while jumping/pogoing.

The level design isn't all that bad most of the time, though you could have spent some more time on improving it. Not being able to defeat the slugs is weird, and they're really in the way in some levels, so... In one of the temple levels you also have to wait for platforms way too much, and there are a few blind jumps.

Pogo is acting weird - it's either a low jump or a high jump. Not variable once again, but it doesn't matter as much with the pogo I guess.

You disabled some default keys, like reconfiguring the key settings or pausing the game. I'd leave those in if I were you, even if they're mostly hotkeys only known by Clickers. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

There was no way to quit, other than die or press alt+F4. In relation to the pausing thing, you might want to pause the game and pop up a menu when pressing escape.

I think there are extensions available to access the alt key, like the Control X object or the Alt key object. Use this to be able to map pogo-ing to the alt key. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

Platforms have issues, like not being able to jump or pogo correctly on them. If you fall, there is also no limit on how fast you can fall, so if you fall TOO fast you fall through some objects (can be remedied by using fastloops to move Keen - it'll never skip a single inbetween pixel while falling!).

The enemies shared some values regulary. For example, if you stand on a mad mushroom in level 2, ALL mushrooms get mad, not just that one. Make sure to make all instances of an enemy unique by spreading a value so you can make sure only that enemy will do things like this!

While typing in here, I lost all of my bullets and I keep pogo-ing when I return to the game. The game takes input while not being focused - fix?

Looking up and down results in Keen barely being visible anymore, you might want to lower the amount of how much Keen can look up or down.

Keen has this brown star on his helmet, not a G. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

Just a question - did you have any one beta test the game before you released it? If not, at least half of the things I said might have been fixed before first release if you had someone test it. Probably. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

EDIT: btw, the music is a tad simple (no counter melody and not much instruments supporting the background of the song), and there are some regular mistakes in the remixes (like the forest song having a few notes that go half a note too low).____________
Don't see me as an ordinary man.
Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]
Oh, and [url=http://www.tengusoft.net/]Team[/url].

title: Re: Commander Keen 20,000
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Using some kind of tiling system and the array object, level editing becomes easier, accessible for non-MMF users, your game becomes expandable, and the biggest advantage is that you will only ever need one frame that loads the correct level file - which means that if you change an event, you don't have to go through all the frames changing all of them.[hr][/quote]

Sounds cool. Can you help?

[quote]Quote:[hr]
Not being able to save and load is REALLY lacking this game. Sure, you get a password every once in a while, but that's just... so un-Keenish! It's not difficult to make a save file - just store the lives, score etcetera in an INI when pressing a function key.[hr][/quote]

Judgement call. I *like* passwords. But I'll take this into consideration.

[quote]Quote:[hr]
Not being able to see the stats without pressing a key is not handy. Try to do like they did in the original games - some basic stats where you have the level name right now. Those stats are more important than a level name, so make those show up by default. In fact, there's plenty of space to leave the level name below it or something.[hr][/quote]

Touche. This will be the first thing I fix in version one-point-whatever.

[quote]Quote:[hr]
Menus are useful, and they just really feel neglected in this game. Select an option and you get a red screen full of text - could use polish.[hr][/quote]

Any specific ideas?

[quote]Quote:[hr]
Movement is a bit sloppy in some cases. For example, collision around climbable borders gives some problems occasionally, like Keen getting a jump boost or still moving a bit while hanging onto the ledge.[hr][/quote]

That's well and truly as good as it's gonna get.

[quote]Quote:[hr]Jumping is fixed height, while variable height jumping could make for some nice level designs.[hr][/quote]

Huh? When should jump height vary?

[quote]Quote:[hr]Oh, I just remembered, slope walking works like crap, you need to fix that. Use a fastloop to push him down a few pixels if some bottom detector is overlapping the ground, but Keen isn't, for example.[hr][/quote]

Looking at it right now.

[quote]Quote:[hr]More movement system problems: rapid shooting when jumping and shooting down, being able to shoot while pogo-ing and NOT stopping to pogo, small animation problems when walking against irregular walls or doing stuff while jumping/pogoing.[hr][/quote]

See above.

[quote]Quote:[hr]The level design isn't all that bad most of the time, though you could have spent some more time on improving it. Not being able to defeat the slugs is weird[hr][/quote]

You can defeat them, just not in the conventional way.

[quote]Quote:[hr]the temple levels you also have to wait for platforms way too much, and there are a few blind jumps.[hr][/quote]

Will look at it on the weekend.

[quote]Quote:[hr]There was no way to quit, other than die or press alt+F4.[hr][/quote]

Or to press F7 (see the help screen)

[quote]Quote:[hr] Platforms have issues, like not being able to jump or pogo correctly on them. If you fall, there is also no limit on how fast you can fall, so if you fall TOO fast you fall through some objects (can be remedied by using fastloops to move Keen - it'll never skip a single inbetween pixel while falling!).[hr][/quote]

I think instead I will just cap the fall speed.

[quote]Quote:[hr]The enemies shared some values regulary. For example, if you stand on a mad mushroom in level 2, ALL mushrooms get mad, not just that one. Make sure to make all instances of an enemy unique by spreading a value so you can make sure only that enemy will do things like this![hr][/quote]

Will look at it on the weekend.

[quote]Quote:[hr]While typing in here, I lost all of my bullets and I keep pogo-ing when I return to the game. The game takes input while not being focused - fix?[hr][/quote]

Look...weekend...etc

[quote]Quote:[hr]Looking up and down results in Keen barely being visible anymore, you might want to lower the amount of how much Keen can look up or down.[hr][/quote]

Again, a personal judgment call.


[quote]Quote:[hr]Keen has this brown star on his helmet, not a G. [hr][/quote]

Are you sure? [url=http://images.google.ca/images?hl=en&q=green+bay+helmet&btnG=Search+Images&gbv=2]images.google.ca/images?h...ages&gbv=2[/url]

[quote]Quote:[hr]Just a question - did you have any one beta test the game before you released it? If not, at least half of the things I said might have been fixed before first release if you had someone test it. Probably. [hr][/quote]

A few people showed mild interest in beta-testing, but (with a few noteworthy exceptions) most people will not go anywhere near anything labelled a 'beta'. Hence this thread. I could have used a set of eyes as astute as yours during beta testing, but as I recall, you were 'too busy to test anything'.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

[quote]Quote:[hr] (like the forest song having a few notes that go half a note too low). [hr][/quote]

Do you mean half a tone too low? That is really puzzling. (I'm almost afraid to ask this but) which notes? EDIT: Do you mean right before the change to A major? That was a flourish, I put that in there on purpose.

title: Re: Commander Keen 20,000
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Sounds cool. Can you help?[hr][/quote]
I've been experimenting with making a level editor in MMF, but I haven't quite found the best way to do it yet. I'll see what I can do.

[quote]Quote:[hr]Any specific ideas?[hr][/quote]
Just a bit more polish. You could try the help screen like Keen 4/5/6 have, which brings you to a sub menu with more help options, story etcetera. There's also graphics and borders in that version. This also makes the main menu smaller as help, story and credits are all within the same sub menu.

For the music test screen, you could use the same thing: the help border.

You don't NEED and extra password frame. Just make the main menu options disappear and make the password entering thing show up right in the main menu. Or go for saving. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
(btw, hitting enter three times in the password screen achieves nothing for me. Escape to return would have been better anyway.)

[quote]Quote:[hr]Huh? When should jump height vary?[hr][/quote]
Never noticed how Keen jumps low when you only tap the jump key, but he jumps higher if you hold the key longer? This is useful for some level design, like having to jump low to avoid ceiling spikes or things like that.

[quote]Quote:[hr]You can defeat them, just not in the conventional way.[hr][/quote]
I noticed. However, where squashing bugs makes sense, squashing huge snails is a bit... weird. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

[quote]Quote:[hr]Or to press F7 (see the help screen)[hr][/quote]
Use escape, there is no way to go to the help screen from a level after all. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

[quote]Quote:[hr]Are you sure? images.google.ca/images?h...ages&gbv=2[hr][/quote]
Yup. Though that helmet looks almost exactly like Keen's, you'll notice that in the Keen games he has a few brown stars there, not a G. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

[quote]Quote:[hr]Do you mean half a tone too low? That is really puzzling. (I'm almost afraid to ask this but) which notes? EDIT: Do you mean right before the change to A major? That was a flourish, I put that in there on purpose.[hr][/quote]
I meant the part where you go from E to D, rather than E to D#. Pretty much the beginning of the melody of the forest theme.

Thanks for considering a few of the things I found. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] ____________
Don't see me as an ordinary man.
Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]
Oh, and [url=http://www.tengusoft.net/]Team[/url].

title: Re: Commander Keen 20,000
content:
I noticed that in the original, and I thought using both major and minor thirds above the root was wierd - it closes up a lot of harmonic possibilities (which I guess I never ended up taking advantage of anyway) but I guess if it's in the original, it's got to be here. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Just curious, what software do you write MIDI sequences with, and what electronic instruments do you render them with?

title: Re: Commander Keen 20,000
content:
Sorry I forgot to reply to your email on beta-testing; I did test it, though.

kohntarkosz, you have once again revolutionized Keen fangames.-----------------------------------
[url=http://youtube.com/watch?v=izxrocVNVOk]Dnde Esta Jeff? [/url]
Take a look at these hands! The hands speaks. The hand of a government man.

title: Re: Commander Keen 20,000
content:
Great game, dude!

Except the Background images, you could have made a better job there, and it was fantastic when the song to lvl 1 and 2 started to loop on lvl 3 at the same time as the 'new' song, so I couldn't hear anything.
It would also be nice with a saving function, it's kind of frustrating to start from the beginning over and over...
Or that I can get a password after Each level.

Duhh, except that. Really great game. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]
